info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Berks, Lehigh and southwestern Northampton Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 651 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ancient Oaks, or 8 miles west of Allentown, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Northampton, Slatington, Walnutport, Topton, Steuben, Neffs, Coffeetown, Berlinsville, Ancient Oaks, Emerald, Lehigh University, Claussville, Beersville, Schnecksville, Catasauqua, Fountain Hill and Coplay. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 51 and 69. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 45 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
